I'm reviewing the experimental functionality of running parallel tests at t=
he class level; i.e. Parallel.classes(), I notice in the ParallelComputer c=
lass, run() method there is a call get with a timeout for 2000 milliseconds=
. Is there a significant reason for this versus get() without any timeout? =
In conducting test without JUnit test cases, I'm finding this timeout featu=
re creates timeout exceptions whereas running JUnit without the timeout all=
ows my test to run successfully. Can anyone explain why this timeout is nee=
ded?
